translated: Discussion of old age and death
Is old age and death supramundane when the states are supramundane?

original: Maggo phalaṁ nibbānaṁ, sotāpattimaggo sotāpattiphalaṁ …pe… bojjhaṅgoti?
analyzed: maggo phalam nibbāna sotāpatti maggo sotāpatti phalam pe bojjhaṅgo ti
translated: “Are the path, fruition, and Nibbāna the path of stream-entry, the fruition of stream-entry … the factors of enlightenment?”

analyzed: sotāpatti maggassa jarā maraṇam sotāpatti maggaḥ ti
translated: “Is old age and death the path of stream-entry?”

analyzed: sotāpatti maggassa jarā maraṇam sotāpatti maggaḥ ti
translated: “Is old age and death the path of stream-entry?”

analyzed: sotāpatti phalassa jarā maraṇam sotāpatti phalanti
translated: “Is old age and death the fruition of stream-entry?”
“Is old age and death the path …

analyzed: arahatta maggassa jarā maraṇam arahatta maggaḥ ti
translated: the path of arahantship old age and death?”

analyzed: arahatta maggassa jarā maraṇam arahatta maggaḥ ti
translated: “Is old age and death the path of arahantship?”

analyzed: arahatta phalassa jarā maraṇam arahatta phalanti
translated: “Is old age and death the fruition of arahantship?”
of the establishments of mindfulness …🔽of the right efforts …
of the bases of spiritual power …

analyzed: jarā maraṇam  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: of the factors for awakening is aging-and-death?”🔽“No,” he said.
“Then is it that the Blessed One has not taught the Dhamma?” “One should not say so.”
The discussion of aging-and-death is finished.
